title: NASA Is Helping Bring Giant Tortoises Back to the Galápagos
summary: Giant tortoises are returning to Floreana Island after more than 150 years, guided by NASA data that shows suitable areas for release.

title: NASA targeting March 6 for Artemis 2 launch
summary:
NASA is targeting a March 6 launch for Artemis 2 after completing a countdown test with few problems.

title: The UK Amends Launch Liability Rules as RFA Prepares for Inaugural Flight
summary:
An amendment to the United Kingdom’s Space Industry Act will mandate that limits are set on how much launch operators are financially liable for if something goes wrong. The government has framed the change as a necessary step to strengthen the country’s position as a competitive launch location. The concept of states being liable for […]

title: Artemis II Crew Trains on T-38
summary: NASA astronaut Christina Koch and Canadian Space Agency astronaut Jeremy Hansen take off on a T-38 training flight from Ellington Field on Feb. 11, 2026, as a waning crescent Moon hovers above. title: NASA completes second Artemis 2 fueling test
summary:
NASA completed a second wet dress rehearsal for the Artemis 2 mission on Feb. 19 without any of the hydrogen leaks seen in the first such test earlier this month.
